reviews.review_msg: Terrible instructor that clearly doesn't care and plays favorites. Unclear expectations, vague instructions, and she's just plain mean. Highly recommend avoiding her at all costs.
Maike is a terrible prof. She plays favorites and doesn't care about you unless you suck up to her. The course wasn't hard but I don't feel like I learned much from her.

Maike is a fantastic sessional prof. As our seminar was mostly unfamiliar with the topic of terrorism, Maike did a great job making it comprehensive and digestible for us. The class integrated current world issues and conflicts which made it super engaging and relevant. Thanks to this class I now know what's going on in the news!

Love love love Maike. Shes incredibly understanding and caring. She makes lectures light and funny and really easy to understand. She focuses on actually learning rather than regurgitating info so her tests are really reasonable and her marking for the group project was really easy. Would take every class with her if I could.
Very interesting course and enjoyed listening to his lectures. It's a great upper division course, although I almost wish that he graded on discussion/participation rather than strictly papers.

While the class is interesting none of the in class lecture material is used for your assessment. Your entire grade is based off a term project including an annotated bib, 12 page paper and a presentation on your topic. The topic can have nothing to do with the course material. So what exactly did I learn? He is also a tough grader.

I really respect Evan and the way he designed this seminar course. I loved that a majority of the semester we got to spend learning about a topic we chose, and despite the theory part of the course being a bit boring I understand why it was necessary. The exam was really easy, and Evan was very clear about his expectations for all assignments.

The best professor I've ever met at SFU so far. He is caring, knowledgeable, and well-organized. He always wishes you enjoy studying laws and shape your own analysis rather than making you memorize everything. He is strict but always cares about everyone in the class to ensure you understand materials and be able to use it in real-life circumstace

I loved Dr. Ha's class! She's so genuine and it's obvious that she cares about her students. She gives great feedback and was really accessible outside of class. It was necessary to do the readings in order to actively participate in class discussions - which were always lively and engaging.

This was a seminar class, and so participation is everything- But Dr. Ha made it so easy to express your own thoughts and opinions. She genuinely cared for all her student's success and was extremely approachable with everything. If you take a class with her you literally won't regret it. Hoping to have another course with her soon!
